subject: Art & Design
title: Ethical Persuasion vs. Manipulation
description: A micro-lesson that makes Ethical Persuasion vs. Manipulation usable.

hook.text: Duolingo's streak counter motivates learning. A gambling app's near-miss animation motivates addiction.

buildup.text: Persuasion becomes manipulation when it benefits the designer at the user's expense, especially without transparency.

discovery.text: The test: would users still engage if they fully understood the psychological technique being used on them?

twist.text: Many 'engagement' metrics are actually addiction metrics. Time-on-app isn't inherently good for the user.

climax.text: Tristan Harris' Center for Humane Technology pushes tech companies to align business goals with user well-being.

punchline.text: The line between helpful and harmful is intent. Design reveals it.

quiz.question: How can you distinguish ethical persuasion from manipulation in design?
options: Ethical persuasion benefits the user even when the technique is transparent
There is no real difference between the two
